sentences: Formed in London in the 1970s, it has had a sporadic existence ever since, disbanding in the 1980s then reforming.
In the same year a 12" single was released on Small Wonder Records by the same musicians as Frank Sumatra And The Mob.

Also released were the mini-albums Sunday Girls and Schizophrenia Party on Fresh, and later the All Styles double-LP on Jungle Records, which Trouser Press hailed as "consistently enjoyable and infused with invention, cleverness, talent and a totally open outlook"Alig Fodder continued to record and perform as Family Fodder over the years with evolving line-ups as well as under various alter-egos such as DJ Katface, Johnny Human, Vox Humana and The Lo Yo Yo.

Following the release of compilation Savoir Faire: The Best Of on US label Dark Beloved Cloud, in 2000 an early Family Fodder line-up including Levillain reformed to record the album Water Shed for that label.
To coincide, original members of the band reformed with a new singer Bee Ororo, and played live dates in Germany, France and Switzerland.
Frank Sumatra And The Mob, "Te Deum", Maxi 45 rpm, Small Wonder Records, 1979
Professor Zoom (Alig=Johnny Human, Mick Hobbs, Sam Alexander, Rick Wilson, Graham Painting, Professor Zoom), Urban Menace/1965, Alligator Discs, 1994
Alig Fodder, Alphabet Series Q, 45 rpm, Tomlab, 2007
Sunday Girls (A Tribute To Blondie By Family Fodder And Friends), Maxi 45rpm Mini-Album, Parole Records, Fresh Records, 1979
The Lo Yo Yo (Steve Wright, Alig, Annie Hunt, Carrie Brooks, Mick Hobbs), id., Cassette-Album, Calypso Now, 1984
The Lo Yo Yo, Extra Weapons, 33rpm, Floppy Discs, 1985

DJ Katface / Kommissar Hjuler und Frau (John Pearce, Kommissar Hjuler, Mama Baer), Pragmatix, 4 titles, 60 minutes, CDR 11 copies, Asylum Lunaticum (Germany) and Cassette-album, 88 copies, Nagranie Brutalnie Domowy (Poland), 2010
Kommissar Hjuler & Frau & KH12 / Jonathan Meese, Album, Psych. KG, 2019
